Description: Students explain what they are learning from exams, and evaluate the fairness, usefulness, and quality of tests.
Students write an animal fable (or at least sketch its outline) that will lead to a one-sentence moral matching the current concept discussed in class.
Students pair words with definitions in a fast-paced game format to reinforce vocabulary retention.
Students read a short passage aloud and discuss key points to improve comprehension.
Students create a quick visual representation of a concept to demonstrate understanding through art.
Students exchange written work and provide constructive feedback using a guided rubric.
